section.name: Portal home's customization
section.p: This guide assumes that you are already familiar with Flexbox layout in CSS to integrate your own widgets, change the order of the widgets.
The default home page of Portal has three built-in widgets in order: Process widget , Task widget , Statistic widget . If it doesn't fit your needs, you can replace it by your own one.
Following these steps to have your own Portal Home:

li.p: Create a new home page which uses the DefaultHomePageTemplate.xhtml template. By doing this, your new home page will inherit the widgets from the default home page and has a place holder for your own widgets. You must pass data into task widget and statistic widget based on the parameters: tasks and tasksForStatistic .

Create a new process start for the new home page. Now you will use this process start as the entry point of your portal instead of the default one. To let portal know about your new portal home, you have to go to the portal settings and set the portal home url to the new one.

section.p: The DefaultHomePageTemplate.xhtml template supports some customization:

li.a: Change the order of the default widgets

section.h4: Change the order of the default widgets
section.p: The template has three parameters: processWidgetPosition , taskWidgetPosition , statisticWidgetPosition to display the default widgets in order. Their default values are 0, you can set them to integer numbers to have the order as you need.

img.title: Change the order of the default widgets

section.p: The template has three parameters: displayProcessWidget , displayTaskWidget , displayStatisticWidget to display or hide the default widgets. Their default values are true, you can set them to boolean values (true/false) to display or hide them as you need.
The template has the placeholders to redefine the default widgets' sections.
The template has a placeholder to add your own widgets. Your own widgets' default positions are next to statistic widget, you can change them by setting the default widgets' positions.
